validationRules.block_id: Required - unique identifier for tabs block
validationRules.navPosition: For horizontal: 'top' or 'bottom'. For vertical: 'left' or 'right'
validationRules.tablistRepeater: Array of tab items - minimum 2 items required for meaningful tabs
validationRules.activeTab: String - index of default active tab (e.g., '0' for first, '1' for second)
validationRules.vernavWidth: Only applies when tabLayout is 'vertical' - sets sidebar width
validationRules.contentType: In each tab item: either 'content' (default) or 'template'
validationRules.blockTemp: Required when contentType is 'template' - WordPress template slug
validationRules.innerIcon: Boolean in each tab item - when true, requires innericonName
validationRules.outerIcon: Boolean in each tab item - adds separator icon after tab

warnings: Never modify block_id after tabs creation - breaks references
onhoverTab: 'hover' doesn't work on touch devices (mobile/tablet)
tabLayout and navPosition must be compatible (horizontal with top/bottom, vertical with left/right)
vernavWidth only applies when tabLayout is 'vertical'
fullwidthIcon places icons above text instead of next to it - increases tab height
swiperEffect preloads all tab content - may impact performance with many tabs
Template tabs (contentType: 'template') require existing WordPress templates
outerIcon on last tab creates trailing separator - set to false on last item
activeTab uses string index ('0', '1', '2') not numbers
hideToggle.xs: true converts tabs to accordion on mobile - test thoroughly
commonMistakes: Forgetting to set vernavWidth when using vertical layout
Using onhoverTab: 'hover' for critical mobile content
Setting outerIcon: true on the last tab (creates trailing separator)
Using number for activeTab instead of string (should be '0' not 0)
Not setting blockTemp when contentType is 'template'
Setting fullwidthIcon without increasing iconSize (icons too small)
Forgetting to set innericonName when innerIcon: true
Not testing hideToggle behavior on actual mobile devices
bestPractices: Use horizontal layout for 2-5 tabs, vertical for 4+ tabs or sidebar navigation
Set activeTab to first tab ('0') or most important tab for better UX
Use click activation (onhoverTab: 'click') for accessibility and mobile compatibility
Provide icons for visual distinction between tabs (improves scanability)
Use fullwidthIcon mode for icon-heavy designs with short tab titles
Configure vernavWidth responsively (md: 250px → sm: 200px → xs: 100%)
Use hideToggle to convert tabs to accordion on mobile for better UX
Limit tabs to 5-7 items for best user experience (more = overwhelming)
Use semantic tab titles that clearly describe content
Test on mobile devices - tabs should be easy to tap (minimum 44×44px)
Use swiperEffect for sequential content (steps, processes, tutorials)

responsiveStrategy.description: Tabs adapt to screen sizes using md (desktop), sm (tablet), xs (mobile) breakpoints
responsiveStrategy.recommendedApproach: Configure md first, then override sm/xs only where needed. Use hideToggle to convert tabs to accordion on mobile.
commonResponsivePatterns: Convert tabs to accordion on mobile: hideToggle md: false → xs: true
Reduce vertical nav width on mobile: vernavWidth md: '250px' → xs: '100%'
Smaller icons on mobile: iconSize md: '40px' → xs: '28px'
Full-width tabs on mobile for easier tapping
Stack tab content vertically on small screens automatically

accessibilityNotes: Tabs should be keyboard navigable - Arrow keys to switch tabs, Tab to move to content
Use onhoverTab: 'click' for keyboard accessibility (hover doesn't work)
Tab titles act as buttons - provide clear, descriptive text
Ensure sufficient color contrast for tab text (WCAG AA: 4.5:1 minimum)
Active tab should have clear visual indicator (color, underline, border)
Use semantic HTML - tabs use proper ARIA roles automatically
Test keyboard navigation - users should be able to access all tabs via keyboard
